intro: Pilosella tephrophyton, commonly known as the alpine pilosella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance, and it produces small, inconspicuous seeds that are dispersed by wind. Pilosella tephrophyton is often found in meadows and grasslands at high altitudes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
